014package org.jdbi.v3.core.array;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Optional;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes;
022
023/**
024 * Factory interface to produce {@link SqlArrayType} instances.
025 */
026@FunctionalInterface
027public interface SqlArrayTypeFactory {
028    /**
029     * Returns an {@link SqlArrayType} for the given {@code elementType} if this factory supports it; empty otherwise.
030     *
031     * @param elementType the array element type
032     * @param config the config registry, for composition
033     * @return an {@link SqlArrayType} for the given {@code elementType} if this factory supports it; empty otherwise.
034     * @see SqlArrayTypes#findFor(Type)
035     */
036    Optional<SqlArrayType<?>> build(Type elementType, ConfigRegistry config);
037
038    /**
039     * Create a SqlArrayTypeFactory for the given {@code elementType} that binds using a
040     * type name and convert function.
041     * @param elementType the array element type
042     * @param typeName the database type name to bind as
043     * @param conversion the function to convert to jdbc representation
044     * @return the built factory
045     * @see SqlArrayType#of(String, Function)
046     */
047    static <T> SqlArrayTypeFactory of(Class<T> elementType, String typeName, Function<T, ?> conversion) {
048        final Optional<SqlArrayType<?>> arrayType = Optional.of(SqlArrayType.of(typeName, conversion));
049        return (t, c) -> elementType == GenericTypes.getErasedType(t) ? arrayType : Optional.empty();
050    }
051}
